definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: The children are always up to amusing tricks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们总是调皮捣蛋寻开心。

sentences.english: We pissed our teacher off again today, horsing around and acting up.
sentences.chinese: 今天我们调皮捣蛋，又把老师给惹怒了。

sentences.english: Bad: There is always a bad apple in every class.
sentences.chinese: 每个班级都有一个调皮捣蛋的学生。

sentences.english: Lavish on the love and hugs and strokes when she isn't into mischief.
sentences.chinese: 当她不调皮捣蛋时给她足够的爱，拥抱和抚摸。

sentences.english: The children have been acting up all evening.
sentences.chinese: 整个晚上孩子们都在调皮捣蛋。

sentences.english: A rowdy kid like that is just the kind that parents dote on .
sentences.chinese: 做父母所宠爱的，正是这种调皮捣蛋的孩子。

sentences.english: He chuckled at the child's mischievousness.
sentences.chinese: 他对这个小孩的调皮捣蛋低声轻笑。

definition: to cause trouble/to stir up trouble
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to only want to have a good time/to just want to have fun, and to shy away from self-discipline
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
